meanings.definition: (古代ローマ)無産市民階級の兵士; 官吏の従者
meanings.english_definition: (Ancient Rome) A soldier of the lowest class; an attendant to a magistrate.

examples.sentence: The accensor followed the magistrate everywhere.
examples.translation: アッケンソールはどこへでも長官に従った。

etymology.value: From Latin accendere, "to kindle, set on fire, light up; to inflame, incense, excite, provoke; to add to, augment, increase, swell; to light, illuminate".
